comments:
An eclipse configuration that doesn't include the JDT (e.g. just the CDT) will
issue an error when opening the Resource perspective. The log file indicates
that there is a dependency on the JDT class org.eclipse.jdt.ui.PackageExplorer.
If the dependency is OK, then the error should be caught and the platform
should remain silent. I am using the Eclipse Platform:
Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050627-1435
Created an attachment (id=26928)
error log

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 2005-09-07 10:21:36.850
!MESSAGE Exception in org.eclipse.ui.internal.PageLayout.stackView:
org.eclipse.ui.PartInitException: Could not create view:
org.eclipse.jdt.ui.PackageExplorer
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.ui.PartInitException: Could not create view:
org.eclipse.jdt.ui.PackageExplorer
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ViewFactory.createView(ViewFactory.java:151)

	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.LayoutHelper.createView(LayoutHelper.java:159)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.PageLayout.createView(PageLayout.java:449)
The exception comes from PerspectiveExtensionReader.  There must be some plug-in
in your configuration that has an extension on the
org.eclipse.ui.perspectiveExtensions extension point adding the package explorer
to the resource perspective.  This does not come from the Resource perspective
itself, or any other extension in Platform UI.
Please check other plug-ins in your configuration.
(In reply to comment #2)

Indeed, I have found the offending plugin. Thanks for the clarification.

> The exception comes from PerspectiveExtensionReader.  There must be some plug-in
> in your configuration that has an extension on the
> org.eclipse.ui.perspectiveExtensions extension point adding the package explorer
> to the resource perspective.  This does not come from the Resource perspective
> itself, or any other extension in Platform UI.
> Please check other plug-ins in your configuration.
>
